'''1.9.19''', the release of the '''[[Discovery Update]]''',<ref>{{Mcnet|new-nintendo-3ds-update|New Nintendo 3DS Update|January 15, 2019}}</ref><ref>{{cite|url=https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/articles/360022028351|title=Minecraft: New Nintendo 3DS Edition - 1.9}}</ref> is the final update for {{el|ds}}, released on January 15–16, 2019. It added many new features primarily focused on exploration (similar to [[Java Edition 1.11]]), such as [[woodland mansion]]s and [[explorer map]]s. It also added some features revolving around the color palette of the game (similar to [[Java Edition 1.12]]), such as [[concrete]] and [[glazed terracotta]]. Other new features included new [[mob]]s, such as [[llama]] and [[vex]]es.

=== Blocks ===
{{Animate|White Concrete.png; Light Gray Concrete.png; Gray Concrete.png; Black Concrete.png; Brown Concrete.png; Red Concrete.png; Orange Concrete.png; Yellow Concrete.png; Lime Concrete.png; Green Concrete.png; Cyan Concrete.png; Light Blue Concrete.png; Blue Concrete.png; Purple Concrete.png; Magenta Concrete.png; Pink Concrete.png|32px}} '''[[Concrete]]'''
* Comes in the 16 traditional [[dye]] colors.
* Created when [[concrete powder]] comes into contact with [[water]].

{{Animate|White Concrete Powder.png; Light Gray Concrete Powder.png; Gray Concrete Powder.png; Black Concrete Powder.png; Brown Concrete Powder.png; Red Concrete Powder.png; Orange Concrete Powder.png; Yellow Concrete Powder.png; Lime Concrete Powder.png; Green Concrete Powder.png; Cyan Concrete Powder.png; Light Blue Concrete Powder.png; Blue Concrete Powder.png; Purple Concrete Powder.png; Magenta Concrete Powder.png; Pink Concrete Powder.png|32px}} '''[[Concrete powder]]'''
* Comes in the 16 traditional [[dye]] colors.
* [[Gravity]] affected (like [[sand]] and [[gravel]]).
* When it touches water, it turns into a [[concrete]] block.
* Can be crafted from 4 [[sand]] and 4 [[gravel]].

{{Animate|White Glazed Terracotta JE2 BE2.png; Light Gray Glazed Terracotta JE1 BE1.png; Gray Glazed Terracotta JE1 BE1.png; Black Glazed Terracotta JE1 BE1.png; Brown Glazed Terracotta JE1 BE1.png; Red Glazed Terracotta JE1 BE1.png; Orange Glazed Terracotta JE2 BE2.png; Yellow Glazed Terracotta JE1 BE1.png; Lime Glazed Terracotta JE1 BE1.png; Green Glazed Terracotta JE1 BE1.png; Cyan Glazed Terracotta JE2 BE2.png; Light Blue Glazed Terracotta JE1 BE1.png; Blue Glazed Terracotta JE1 BE1.png; Purple Glazed Terracotta JE2.png; Magenta Glazed Terracotta JE2 BE2.png; Pink Glazed Terracotta JE1 BE1.png|32px}} '''[[Glazed terracotta]]'''
* Comes in the 16 traditional [[dye]] colors.
* Can be obtained by [[smelting]] [[terracotta]].

{{Animate|White Bed JE2 BE2.png; Light Gray Bed JE2 BE2.png; Gray Bed JE2 BE2.png; Black Bed JE2 BE2.png; Brown Bed JE2 BE2.png; Red Bed (N) JE2.png; Orange Bed JE2 BE2.png; Yellow Bed JE2 BE2.png; Lime Bed JE2 BE2.png; Green Bed JE2 BE2.png; Cyan Bed JE2 BE2.png; Light Blue Bed JE2 BE2.png; Blue Bed JE2 BE2.png; Purple Bed JE2 BE2.png; Magenta Bed JE2 BE2.png; Pink Bed JE2 BE2.png|32px}} '''Dyed [[bed]]s'''
* Can be crafted with colored [[wool]] or by dyeing a white [[bed]].

{{Animate|White Shulker Box.png; Light Gray Shulker Box.png; Gray Shulker Box.png; Black Shulker Box.png; Brown Shulker Box.png; Red Shulker Box.png; Orange Shulker Box.png; Yellow Shulker Box.png; Lime Shulker Box.png; Green Shulker Box.png; Cyan Shulker Box.png; Light Blue Shulker Box.png; Blue Shulker Box.png; Purple Shulker Box JE3 BE1.png; Magenta Shulker Box.png; Pink Shulker Box.png|32px}} '''[[Shulker box]]'''
* Works similarly to a [[chest]], but keeps its content when broken.
** If it has any contents inside, it will drop itself in [[Creative]] mode as well.
** Cannot be placed inside another shulker box.
* Can be crafted by using a [[chest]] and two [[Shulker Shell|shulker shells]].
* Can be dyed in any of the available [[dye]] colors.

{{Animate|Frosted Ice BE1.png; Frosted Ice 1 JE1 BE1.png; Frosted Ice 2 JE1 BE1.png; Frosted Ice 3 JE1 BE1.png|32px}} '''[[Frosted ice]]'''
* Created when using [[Frost Walker]].
* Cannot be obtained in inventory, even when using [[Silk Touch]].

[[File:Magma Block JE1.gif|32px]] '''[[Magma block]]'''
* Can be crafted using four [[magma cream]].
* Can generate in [[the Nether]].
* [[Mob]]s and players take {{hp|1}} damage every second while touching it, similar to a [[cactus]].
* It emits as much [[light]] as it receives from other sources.

[[File:Bone Block (UD) JE1 BE1.png|32px]] '''[[Bone block]]'''
* Can be crafted from 9 [[bone meal]].
** Can be crafted back into 9 bone meal.

[[File:Nether Wart Block JE1 BE1.png|32px]] '''[[Nether wart block]]'''
* Can be crafted from 9 [[nether wart]].
** It cannot be crafted back into nether wart.

[[File:Red Nether Bricks JE1 BE1.png|32px]] '''[[Red nether brick]]'''
* Can be crafted from 2 nether wart and 2 nether bricks.

=== Items ===
{{Animate|Woodland Explorer Map JE1 BE1.png; Ocean Explorer Map JE1 BE1.png|32px}} '''[[Explorer map]]'''
* Can only be obtained from cartographer [[Villager|villagers]].
* Can be used to locate some [[structure]]s.

[[File:Totem of Undying JE1 BE1.png|32px]] '''[[Totem of undying]]'''
* Can be obtained from killing [[evoker]]s.
* Holding it in a hotbar slot when the player dies will activate it and save their life.
** Gives player the [[Absorption]] and [[Regeneration]] effects when activated.

{{Animate|Iron Nugget JE1 BE1.png; Gold Nugget JE2 BE1.png|32px}} '''[[Iron Nugget|Iron]] and [[gold nugget]]s'''
* Can be smelted from [[iron]] and [[gold]] [[tool]]s and [[armor]].
* Can be also obtained from [[iron ingot]]s or [[gold ingot]]s.

{{Animate|Evoker Spawn Egg JE1 BE1.png; Llama Spawn Egg JE1 BE1.png; Vex Spawn Egg JE1 BE1.png; Vindicator Spawn Egg JE1 BE1.png|32px}} '''[[Spawn egg]]s for evokers, llamas, vexes and vindicators'''
* Used to spawn [[evoker]]s, [[llama]]s, [[vex]]es or [[vindicator]]s.

=== Mobs ===
[[File:Creamy Llama Revision 1.png|32px]] '''[[Llama]]s'''
* Spawns in [[hill]]s and [[savanna]] [[Biome|biomes]].
* Attacks by spitting.
* Neutral to mobs and players.

[[File:Vindicator JE1 BE1.png|24px]] '''[[Vindicator]]s'''
* Hostile towards [[Player|players]] and [[villager]]s.
* Holds an [[iron axe]].
* Spawn in the [[Woodland Mansion|woodland mansions]] upon generation. They will not respawn.
* May drop [[Emerald|emeralds]] and an [[iron axe]] upon death.

[[File:Evoker JE1 BE1.png|24px]] '''[[Evoker]]s'''
* In battle, they will summon [[Vex|vexes]] and fangs to attack.
* Hostile towards [[Player|players]] and [[Villager|villagers]].
* Will always drop a [[Totem of Undying|totem of undying]] upon death. May drop [[Emerald|emeralds]] too.

[[File:Vex JE1 BE1.png|32px]] '''[[Vex]]es'''
* Spawn only when summoned by an [[evoker]].
* Hostile towards [[Player|players]] and [[Villager|villagers]].
* Holds an [[iron sword]] in their main hand.
** Cannot drop their [[iron sword]].

[[File:Librarian.png|24px]] '''Cartographer [[villager]]s'''
* White-robed villagers ([[librarian]]s) that can sell [[explorer map]]s.

=== World generation ===
[[File:Woodland Mansion.png|32px]] '''[[Woodland mansion]]'''
* [[Illager]]s spawn here.
* Can be located with a woodland explorer maps.

[[File:Fossil Spine 4.png|32px]] '''Underground [[fossil]]s'''
* Generate in the underground.

'''Natural [[magma block]] generation in [[the Nether]]'''
